info_modal.welcome.title: Welcome to Green Paths
info_modal.cookie.info: This site uses cookies to log anonymous visitor counts via Google Analytics, and thus some information of your browser (e.g. IP address) is shared with Google. By clicking OK below, you accept this use of cookies. Alternatively, you can disable analytics & cookies:
info_modal.dev_status_info: The app and its real-time air quality data source are still under active development and hence not guaranteed to work at all times.
info_modal.problem.title: Problem
info_modal.problem.content: While fresh air, quietness and greenery bring health benefits, then air pollution and excess noise may cause physical and mental health problems such as respiratory infections, cardiovascular disease or stress. Fortunately, a more peaceful, less polluted and greener (= healthier) route may be just slightly longer than the shortest one.
info_modal.solution.title: Solution
info_modal.solution.content: This tool guides you to take pleasant walks to your destinations in Helsinki. You may compare routes from the shortest to the least polluted or quietest and find your own optimal way. The more you value peaceful and pleasant urban environment, the longer routes you may be ready to take.
info_modal.method.title: Data & methods

info_modal.method.content.noise_data.des: is based on an assessment conducted by the city of Helsinki (CC BY 4.0). It is a modelled GIS data representing

info_modal.method.content.otp.descriptio: and processed into street network graph with
info_modal.method.content.gvi.descriptio: Green view (i.e. greenery) layer is derived from
info_modal.method.content.gvi.gsv_link_l: analyzing Google Street View images (Toikka et al. 2020)
